meanings.definition: The act of bending or turning backward.
meanings.sent1: His retroflection surprised everyone as he effortlessly bent backward to touch his toes.
meanings.sent2: The mirror showed a clear retroflection of the mountain behind us.
meanings.sent3: During the yoga class, his retroflection made everyone chuckle as he tried to touch his heels.
meanings.sent4: Her retroflection on past mistakes made her realize the importance of learning from them.
meanings.sent5: The retroflection of the sunset on the lake was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The state of being reflected or turned back.
meanings.sent1: The retroflection of sound off the walls made it difficult to hear clearly.
meanings.sent2: The retroflection of light off the water created a beautiful shimmering effect.
meanings.sent3: The retroflection of his words made her stop and think about their true meaning.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a retroflection of the happiness she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The retroflection of the moon on the lake was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A reflection or image thrown back.
meanings.sent1: The retroflection of the tree in the pond looked like a painting.
meanings.sent2: The retroflection of the building in the glass windows was distorted.
meanings.sent3: The retroflection of his face in the mirror made him realize he needed a shave.
meanings.sent4: Her retroflection in the water made her feel like she was looking at a twin.
meanings.sent5: The retroflection of the clouds in the lake was like a mirror image.
